intro: Aruba acuminata, commonly known as the Aruba acuminata, is a flowering plant native to the island of Aruba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
